nodes.title: Understand the importance of authentication
nodes.desc: Recognize why authentication is crucial for security and data protection in various applications. [OWASP](https://owasp.org/www-community/Authentication)

nodes.title: Session-based authentication
nodes.desc: Use server-side sessions to store user data and authenticate requests. [MDN Web Docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Session_management)

nodes.title: LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol)
nodes.desc: Utilize a directory service protocol for authentication, authorization, and directory management. [LDAP](https://ldap.com/)

nodes.title: Smart cards
nodes.desc: Use secure tokens with embedded microprocessors to store and manage cryptographic keys for authentication. [Smart Card Alliance](https://www.smartcardalliance.org/)

nodes.title: Biometric authentication
nodes.desc: Use unique physical or behavioral characteristics, such as fingerprints or facial recognition, to authenticate users. [Biometric Institute](https://www.biometricinstitute.org/)

nodes.title: Risk-based authentication
nodes.desc: Dynamically adjust authentication requirements based on user behavior and risk factors. [RSA](https://www.rsa.com/en-us/products/rsa-risk-based-authentication)

nodes.title: Device fingerprinting
nodes.desc: Collect information about devices to identify and authenticate users. [Device Fingerprinting](https://www.devicefingerprinting.com/)

nodes.title: Behavioral biometrics
nodes.desc: Analyze user behavior to detect and prevent unauthorized access. [Behavioral Biometrics](https://www.behavioralbiometrics.com/)

nodes.title: JSON Web Tokens (JWT)
nodes.desc: Utilize digitally signed tokens to authenticate and authorize users. [JWT.io](https://jwt.io/)

nodes.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
nodes.desc: Implement a centralized authentication system to manage multiple applications. [Okta](https://www.okta.com/use-cases/single-sign-on/)

nodes.title: OAuth 2.0
nodes.desc: Use an authorization framework to grant third-party applications limited access to user resources. [OAuth 2.0](https://oauth.net/2/)

nodes.title: Password-based authentication
nodes.desc: Use passwords to authenticate users, with considerations for password hashing and salting. [OWASP](https://owasp.org/www-community/passwords)

nodes.title: Multi-factor authentication
nodes.desc: Enhance security by requiring additional factors beyond passwords, such as biometrics or one-time passwords. [Microsoft](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/authentication/concept-mfa-howitworks)

nodes.title: OpenID Connect
nodes.desc: Use an identity layer on top of OAuth 2.0 to authenticate users and obtain profile information. [OpenID Connect](https://openid.net/connect/)

nodes.title: SAML (Security Assertion Markup Language)
nodes.desc: Implement a standardized protocol for exchanging authentication and authorization data between systems. [SAML](https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=security)

nodes.title: Kerberos
nodes.desc: Use a ticket-based authentication protocol to provide secure authentication for distributed systems. [Kerberos](https://web.mit.edu/kerberos/)
